block.p: Jane Townsend Banta, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Banta of Poughkeepsie, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Richard Edward Fisher, a son of Lyle F. Brehm of Summit, N.J., and the late William R. Fisher. The Rev. Gilbert McKenzie performed the ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church.

Mrs. Fisher, 29, is a corporate sales executive at Tiffany & Company in New York. She graduated from Boston University. Her father owns Banta Holdings, a franchiser of hotels and restaurants, in Poughkeepsie.

Jane Townsend Banta, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Banta of Poughkeepsie, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Richard Edward Fisher, a son of Lyle F. Brehm of Summit, N.J., and the late William R. Fisher. The Rev. Gilbert McKenzie performed the ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church.

Mrs. Fisher, 29, is a corporate sales executive at Tiffany & Company in New York. She graduated from Boston University. Her father owns Banta Holdings, a franchiser of hotels and restaurants, in Poughkeepsie.

Mr. Fisher, also 29, is a vice president in securities trading in the New York office of Fidelity Capital Markets, a brokerage arm of Fidelity Investments. He graduated from Bowdoin College. His mother is a bond research analyst at Capital Access International, a brokerage research firm in Murray Hill, N.J. His father was the executive vice president of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, the New York investment bank. The bridegroom is a stepson of Robert Brehm.
